topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body: Protip to any aspiring babysitters. When dealing with infants, if it's their first night in a new location and they happen to wake up, they are going to freak out. This is an inevitability. There are unfamiliar with where they are and are, very understandablly, SCARED. Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT start yelling, screaming, or trying to force them asleep. It will only make the situation worse. The best thing to do is pick them up, hold them tightly to your chest, and just walk. While rubbing their back and gently talking to them. It helps relax them and ease them back to sleep.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5469b6476368727c3af30100#post_5469b6476368727c3af30100

_Heard she was pregnant, I’m guilty I reckon cause I hear that good shit can hurt baby’s brain
Heard he was normal 'til three and then he stopped talkin'
Since then, ain’t nothin been the sameSeen her some years later out in Decatur told her that I’m sorry for causin' her pain
Causin' me pain?
Causin' me pain?
She asked again and she grabbed my right hand
Asked am I crazy, said look here, baby, I release you from all of your sins and your shame
Cause I’ve been redeemed
I found in Christ
Whatever it take I hope you find it, Mike
The look on her face shown that glory replaced all the shame and the hate and that she wears a crown
My late grandma Bettie had prayed with her heavy and told her to tell me lay my burdens down_
